intro: Borodiniopsis alaschanica, commonly known as the Alashan borodiniopsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
